Problems with the laserCAN device it says that the roboRIO “refused” the device and i’ve updated the vendordep and ran the code but it still doesnt work. What should I do?

Don’t know but I reported it awhile ago.

The Thrifty Bot 2024 - 2025 Product Releases & Updates General Forum
I know this is a little thing but we were having a little trouble connecting to the lasercan. Everytime we tried to connect it said “device refused connection”. Turns out all we had to do is unplug the robot radio. I saw that in a future update there are plans to be able to assign can id over ethernet/wifi but a little note in the getting started about maybe having to unplug the radio would be cool.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-02-14T04:13:40.189Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":219,"readers_count":218,"score":48.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491643,"topic_slug":"roborio-rejects-lasercan-device","display_username":"jedgar6","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33848,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9410"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-rejects-lasercan-device/491643/6","custom_user_title":"9410","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3526779,"name":"Jaci","username":"Jaci","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaci/{size}/8002_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T04:36:02.682Z","cooked":"

Interesting, are you talking about connection via GrappleHook? That has to be done over USB even if you’re connected via the radio, but the presence of the radio shouldn’t affect it. The CAN bridge specifically binds to USB, so the radio shouldn’t matter at all.

Are you using the Grapple Hook daemon deployment or in user code?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-02-14T04:36:02.682Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":206,"readers_count":205,"score":41.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491643,"topic_slug":"roborio-rejects-lasercan-device","display_username":"Jaci","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Grapple | FRC 10350"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-rejects-lasercan-device/491643/7","custom_user_title":"Grapple | FRC 10350","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3526782,"name":"Jaci","username":"Jaci","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaci/{size}/8002_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T04:43:57.452Z","cooked":"

Ah, just noticed you originally mentioned this in Sept of last year. The radio isn’t the source of the issue here, there’s a bit of a problem with how the rio deals with non-user applications that we’re still fixing - in the latest version of GrappleHook that we released a few weeks ago, it has instructions on how to make a more reliable connection by skipping the daemon altogether by adding a line to your robot code. Going forward, that’s the recommended method since it also doesn’t suspend your robot code.

I’ll get the docs amended, but in the mean time update your GrappleHook and follow the instructions within

Thanks,
Jaci

Is there any way to configure LaserCAN without connecting to the roborio via a usb cable(we broke our usb port) maybe via the Ethernet cable or with using a Ethernet to usb adapter?
